Column Comment.0: PRODUCTION ENTITY SUBTYPE: the type of production entity may be equal to oneof the table names of the PDEN subtype tables, such as PDEN_WELL,PDEN_COUNTY or PDEN_FIELD. Validated by check constraint.
Column Comment.1: PRODUCTION ENTITY IDENTIFIER: An identifier that is unique within a specificproduction entity source and type.
Column Comment.2: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.3: STATUS IDENTIFIER: A unique identifier for the status. In PPDM 39 replaces thedate value in the primary key.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.6: END TIME: Clock time that this status ended.
Column Comment.7: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.8: PERCENT CAPABILITY: The working capability, compared to the maximum possibleexpected. This will enable the capture of a measurement representing the operationalcapacity associated with the status. Percent Capacity is normally calculated at thewell site or facility based on equipment manufacturer specifications, well operationsparameters, etc.
Column Comment.9: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.10: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.11: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.12: START TIME: The clock time that this status came into effect.
Column Comment.13: PDEN STATUS: A reference table identifying the state of the production entity fromthe point of view described in PDEN STATUS TYPE (such as operational status).
Column Comment.14: STATUS DATE: Date the status was reported.
Column Comment.15: PDEN STATUS TYPE: A reference table identifying the type of status, such as theoperational status, the financial status, the legal status, the eligibility status etc.
Column Comment.16: TIMEZONE: a valid list of time zones. You can obtain a list of timezones fromwww.worldtimezone.com.
Column Comment.17: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.18: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.19: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.20: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.21: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.22: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.23: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
